title: SABIC and Partners Unveil Renewable In-Mold Labeling Solution for Food Packaging - Packaging Strategies
summary: SABIC has partnered with three specialists to demonstrate the use of certified renewable polypropylene (PP) resins in high quality mono-PP thin-wall container packaging using in-mold labeling (IML) technology. The resulting packaging can be recycled in existing rigid PP recycling streams and has a low environmental impact. The IML solution will be on display at Taghleef’s Booth 4C35 during Labelexpo in Brussels from September 11-14.
green_innovation: TRUE. The innovation contributes to the environmental sustainability goal of reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE. The innovation is a new business process for the production of in-mold labeled packaging that differs significantly from previous business processes and has been brought into use in the firm.
green_product: TRUE. The certified renewable PP resins for the molded parts and the label film significantly reduce the environmental impact of the packaging throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The IML technology minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by eliminating the need for separately applied adhesive labels on the finished packaging product.
product_or_process: In-mold labeling (IML) of mono-PP thin-wall container packaging
likely_naics_codes: ['325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Plastics Product Manufacturing', '326199 - All Other Plastics Products Manufacturing', '322122 - Plastics Sheet, Film, and Bag Manufacturing', '322211 - Pulp, Paper, and Paperboard Mills']
greenwashing: FALSE. There is no evidence that the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: ALUMOBILITY OUTLINES 8 REASONS WHY ALUMINUM IS THE MATERIAL OF THE FUTURE FOR AUTOMAKERS - PR Newswire
summary: Aluminum has numerous advantages in automotive manufacturing, including increased efficiency, safety, durability, decreased corrosion, and lightweight characteristics. The infinite recyclability of aluminum and its closed loop process allow for reduced carbon emissions and a more circular economy. Alumobility, a global ecosystem of aluminum and downstream technology partners, supports the adoption of aluminum automotive body sheet (ABS) for a lighter, more sustainable mobility future.
green_innovation: TRUE, Aluminum automotive body sheet (ABS) is a green innovation because it contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy and reducing negative environmental externalities of human activity.
business_innovation: TRUE, Aluminum automotive body sheet (ABS) is a business innovation because it is a new or improved product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, Aluminum automotive body sheet (ABS) is a green product because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, The article does not describe a specific green process.

title: The Story Behind Coachtopia, Coach’s New Vision for Circular Fashion - Retail TouchPoints
summary: Coach, a well-known fashion brand, has established Coachtopia as a distinct brand to focus on sustainability, especially circularity in the fashion industry. Coachtopia's Made Circular design principles guide the brand in using recycled or repurposed materials and renewable resources as well as finding ways to reuse waste. Coachtopia's circularity efforts are focused on engaging Gen Z consumers through community involvement, co-creation, and educational initiatives.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the Made Circular design principles guide Coachtopia in using recycled or repurposed materials and renewable resources as well as finding ways to reuse waste.
business_innovation: TRUE, Coachtopia is a new brand that operates separately from the core Coach business so it could operate as a startup and “think radically about rethinking the system and ways of working to pioneer circularity.
green_product: FALSE, the article focuses on Coachtopia's overall circularity principles rather than a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, Coachtopia's circularity efforts include finding ways to reuse waste, which requires the development of new processes.
likely_naics_codes: ['316991 - Luggage, Briefcases, and Other Leather Goods Manufacturing (NAICS)', '454112 - Clothing Stores (NAICS)', '488999 - Other Support Activities for Retail Trade (NAICS)', '561990 - Miscellaneous Retail Stores (NAICS)']
greenwashing: FALSE, Coachtopia's circularity practices appear to be genuine and supported by its community engagement and educational initiatives.
